title: Slow Cooker Cocktail Smokies Recipe
description: This little smokies recipe is made in the slow cooker with mini smoked sausages, barbeque sauce, and grape jelly for a crowd-pleasing party appetizer.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Slow Cooker Appetizers Slow Cooker Cocktail Smokies 4.7 (270) 188 Reviews 22 Photos This little smokies recipe is so easy to make in the slow cooker for a party appetizer. They're great for potlucks as well. The amounts can easily be adapted to suit your needs. Submitted by Malina Bleeding Heart Morris Updated on December 6, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 22 22 22 22 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 2 hrs Total Time: 2 hrs 5 mins Servings: 10 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Get the party started with this old-fashioned little smokies recipe! It’s shockingly easy to make in the slow cooker with just three ingredients.  Meredith Food Studio Little Smokies Ingredients Make these cocktail weenies with just three simple ingredients: a bottle of barbecue sauce, a jar of grape jelly, and mini smoked sausage links. To go the extra mile, you can make your own barbecue sauce and grape jelly at home — but it’s really not necessary for this easy little smokies recipe!  How to Make Little Smokies Simply combine the ingredients in a slow cooker, then cook until heated through. That’s it! Find the full, step-by-step recipe with detailed instructions and cook times below.  Can You Make Little Smokies Ahead of Time?  Sure! You can easily make the little smokies ahead of time. Just store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to four days. Reheat on the stove or in the Crock-Pot before serving.  Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “Delicious! I make it exactly as written,” says Tommi. “My kids request it several times a year and I also make it automatically for every big sporting event.” “This is a very easy recipe to make,” according to TJ. “Great for when I need something to feed many people and not much prep is involved.” “I’m old school and have made these smokies from scratch for years, but this recipe has made my permanent recipe file box,” says DJ. “I used beef smokies with Polander grape jelly and my homemade BBQ sauce. Excellent!” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 1 (12 ounce) bottle barbeque sauce 1 (8 ounce) jar grape jelly 2 (14 ounce) packages miniature smoked sausage links Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine barbecue sauce and grape jelly in a slow cooker. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in miniature smoked sausage links. Cook on High until heated through, about 2 to 3 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook’s Note These little smokies make perfect bite-sized party appetizers (just stick a toothpick in each one). You can also let your guests prepare their own plates by transferring the little smokies to a serving bowl and setting out a ladle.  I Made It Print 717 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 364 Calories 23g Fat 30g Carbs 10g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 10 Calories 364 % Daily Value * Total Fat 23g 29% Saturated Fat 7g 37% Cholesterol 48mg 16% Sodium 1013mg 44% Total Carbohydrate 30g 11% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 24g Protein 10g 20% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 22mg 2% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 475mg 10% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Slow Cooker Cocktail Smokies 01 of 22 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 22 Photo by  CoralDonut3964 09/20/2022 I use sweet baby rays original barbecue sauce with Welch’s Concord grape jelly and I always go back to this recipe it’s simple and tastes amazing!!! 03 of 22 Photo by  Tata 11/22/2020 04 of 22 Photo by  Tata 11/22/2020 05 of 22 Photo by  Faith N 06/06/2020 I've heard about this recipe quite a bit throughout the years and finally gave it a try. I made sure to use original BBQ sauce, not smoky. To me, the BBQ overpowered the grape jelly. They were good, I would just probably omit the jelly next time or use a good bit more and cut down on the BBQ sauce. 06 of 22 Photo by  Carmen Walker 04/10/2020 I love it! I seasoned it as well with garlic, salt, onion, pepper. It’s so yummy! 07 of 22 Photo by  Nancy A Geegan 12/24/2019 08 of 22 Photo by  Chris Doornbos 11/15/2019 09 of 22 Photo by  michelle 07/28/2019 Oh. My. GOSH! So delicious. Where has this recipe been all my life? Easy to make and can't even tell it has grape jelly in it. I followed the recipe exactly using Sweet Baby Ray's Sweet and Spicy sauce, Smuckers Concord Grape jelly, and Hillshore Farms all beef mini sausage links. I will most definitely be making these again for potlucks and get-togethers. 10 of 22 Photo by  Shaun’s wifey 02/03/2019 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Best Cheese Dip 17 Ratings Sausage Stuffing Balls 57 Ratings Big Game Dip 19 Ratings Emily's Easy Sausage and Spicy Tomato Dip 72 Ratings Drunken Sailors 23 Ratings Bacon Wrapped Smokies 1,910 Ratings Kielbasa for the Big Game 32 Ratings Little Smokies 211 Ratings Candied Bacon Pigs 6 Ratings Game Day Sausage Snacks 24 Ratings Sausage Balls I 7 Ratings Cream Cheese Sausage Balls 25 Ratings Sausage Stuffed Mushrooms II 329 Ratings Chorizo Queso Dip 40 Ratings Sausage Pinwheels 27 Ratings Italian Nachos Restaurant-Style 52 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
